intro: Brachyscome ciliaris var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular bristleweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural use.
